edu.up.cs301.game
Class GameComputerPlayer

java.lang.Object
  edu.up.cs301.game.GameComputerPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
GamePlayer, Tickable
Direct Known Subclasses:
TTTComputerPlayer
public abstract class GameComputerPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements GamePlayer, Tickable

An abstract computerized game player player. This is an abstract class, that should be sub-classed to implement different AIs. The subclass must implement the receiveInfo(edu.up.cs301.game.infoMsg.GameInfo) method.

Version:
July 2013
Author:
Steven R. Vegdahl, Andrew Nuxoll

gameSetAsGui

public final void gameSetAsGui(GameMainActivity a)
Sets this player to be the one connected to the GUI. Should only be called if the supportsGUI method returns true.

Specified by:
gameSetAsGui in interface GamePlayer
Parameters:
a - the activity that is being run

setAsGui

public void setAsGui(GameMainActivity activity)
Subclass-behavior for setting this player to be the one associated with the GUI. Typically, changes the current screen to have a new layout, and sets up listeners, animators, etc.

Specified by:
setAsGui in interface GamePlayer
Parameters:
activity - the activity that is being run

gameIsOver

protected void gameIsOver(java.lang.String msg)
callback method--called when we are notified that the game is over

Parameters:

sleep

protected void sleep(int milliseconds)
Sleeps for a particular amount of time. Utility method.

Parameters:
milliseconds - the number of milliseconds to sleep for

requiresGui

public final boolean requiresGui()
Tells whether this player requires a GUI. Since this is a computer player, the answer should be 'false'.

Specified by:
requiresGui in interface GamePlayer

supportsGui

public boolean supportsGui()
tells whether this player supports a GUI. Some computer players may be implemented to do so. In that case, they should implement the 'setAsGui' method.

Specified by:
supportsGui in interface GamePlayer

timerTicked

protected void timerTicked()
Invoked whenever the player's timer has ticked. It is expected that this will be overridden in many games.
